page.title: 02Sport in the Viewpark area
page.content: Sport is very popular in this area especially among the young. We have an annual 'Fun Run'. Tom McKean, a local runner, hopes to make the next Olympics. Many football teams operate, from under age 10 to under 18 as well as amateur sides and one Junior team, Thorniewood. Many of the boys who play out in the streets might become as famous as others from Viewpark. Uddingston has a private tenn- is club as well as a rugby club. It also has an old well-known cricket club which has won many honours in Scotland but not many children play this game. Both Viewpark and Uddingston have bowling clubs with many members. Birkenshaw Sports Centre has sports such as badminton, squash, football and roller-skating too.
